utterances.speaker: RACHEL MADDOW, MSNBC HOST

So the minute you say something he doesn't like, he figures that he can intimidate you like a bully. There's a pernicious evil in trying to divide the country.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So many big words.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yet the voluntarily foul mouthed guy who the media saw as this non-serious butthead is now finally being treated as a serious butthead.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Because he turned on Trump. It's the strange new respect rule. The people who can't stand you will lavish you with attention once you jump ship and the turncoat, he craves it.  So, now he is on CNN and MSNBC who treat him like an Oracle held together with hair gel.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: As he hopes that one day, he'll end up on "Real Housewives of Coney Island."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's so good. He is now among the other desperate oddballs -- Boot, Rubin, Walsh -- they roam the countryside more affected by Trump than the Trump supporters they demean because this is less about the acceptance of Trump than it is a rejection of them.  Mooch is best known for being close to power for 13 seconds.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Mayflies lasted longer in the White House, and that's the motivating factor. After all, Trump has never changed, but The Mooch, the limelight is fading, and that taste of stardom was so delicious. But Trump has moved on. He now wants to buy Greenland.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That is awesome.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And it's no surprise, he is a real estate guy. He probably wants to buy it so he can flip it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Add some granite countertops and a sub-zero fridge. Some nice bathroom amenities. Done. It leads me to wonder, do you love cranes or trucks?

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT
utterances.sentences: I love cranes. I love trucks of all types. Even when I was a little boy at four years old, my mother would say, "You love trucks." I do. I always love trucks. I still do nothing changes. Sometimes, you know you might become President, but nothing changes. I still love trucks.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Nothing changes. But what about the rain?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I said don't worry about the rain. Do we have umbrellas? Don't worry about the rain. Umbrellas work very well.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's so true. He speaks the truth about the umbrella. And what did we send them? Wheat?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: We send them wheat. That's not a good deal. And they don't even want our wheat. They do it because they want us to at least feel that we're okay. You know they do it to make us feel good.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Goodness. And all of a sudden it stops the wind.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: All of a sudden it stops the wind and the televisions go off. And your wives and husbands say, "Darling, I want to watch Donald Trump on television tonight." But the wind stopped blowing and I can't watch. There is no electricity in the house, darling.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Remember when the city used to build little pieces?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: The city used to build little pieces, a little here, a little piece there, a little piece here, a little piece there. A few years later little piece here.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And what about your campaign manager? I hear he is really tall.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: ... is now our campaign manager. And he's one of the tallest human beings I've ever seen. It's nice when you don't have to look for anybody. You just look over and you see a guy who is twice as tall as everyone.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But whether you love him or hate him, you've got to vote for him.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Whether you love me or hate me, you've got to vote for me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So what is the Democratic strategy? To be boring. Thursday's "Washington Post" claims what people want is the opposite of Trump. Someone not so exhausting, who doesn't force you to think constantly about politics. No, I get it. Promising serenity is persuasive. Going from Trump to say Biden, it's like putting on that comfy sweater after a weekend of wearing nothing, but leather chaps.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I know that feeling. But it's BS. Remember, these are the same people who made politics personal and failed at it. So now they're tired of politics interfering with their gloomy personal lives. Screw you. Now, you know how we've felt since the 1960s. The left has been injecting politics into everything -- sports, movies, bedrooms -- everywhere we go, we're being lectured about how we're complicit and evil. Use a straw, you hate sea turtles. Play catch with your kid, you reinforce gender stereotypes. Workout at Equinox, you're obviously Satan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So this, Trump is so exhausting, is just BS. Based on the fact that the BS-sers finally now have real opposition. It's like when they talk of polarization. That's code for "Remember the good old days when there was just one side." Yes, polarization requires an adversary before Trump. Republicans didn't have one that could beat the ugliness coming from that other side. Before Trump, libs could crap on you day and night. Now the Republicans have got a crap cannon.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And it ain't never going to stop shooting crap at them. Of course, now they pretend to want normalcy as they intensify their own campaign of demonization. They keep widening the target. It's not Trump, who is the problem? It's also the people around him and his family and the people who voted for him and people who didn't vote for him, but supportive and people who watch him on TV and people who don't foam at the mouth when he is mentioned and the people who aren't actively resisting him.   It's a combination trade and race war, the left now punishes half the population by targeting, smearing, doxing any businesses that might employ anyone who would support Trump. One wonders how far this could go?

utterances.speaker: AISHAH HASNIE, CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Live from "America's News Headquarters," I'm Aishah Hasnie. An 11th weekend now protesting in Hong Kong. Riot police deployed Saturday evening at several locations across the city. Protesters gathering outside one police station shining laser pointers at police and also pelting them with eggs. Riot police moved in on many of the protesters that had already melted into a crowd in the densely populated district. More bloodshed at Afghanistan, a suicide bomb ripping through a wedding hall in Kabul. Dozens of people were killed or wounded. A spokesman for the Interior Ministry there says more than a thousand people have been invited to that wedding. The explosion coming just days after the end of the Eid al-Adha, a holiday period. It broke more than a week of calm in the capital. No word yet on who is behind the attack. I'm Aishah Hasnie, now back to “The Greg Gutlfeld Show.”

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You got hot and bothered over some guy than "The Godfather." CNN's Chris Cuomo was caught on camera giving it back hard to some guy who called him Fredo. So what do you say? Let's get after it.

So Fredo is an insult to weaker, less intelligent brothers. Play catch with your kid, you reinforce gender stereotypes. Workout at Equinox, you're obviously Satan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So this, Trump is so exhausting, is just BS. Based on the fact that the BS-sers finally now have real opposition. It's like when they talk of polarization. That's code for "Remember the good old days when there was just one side." Yes, polarization requires an adversary before Trump. Republicans didn't have one that could beat the ugliness coming from that other side. Before Trump, libs could crap on you day and night. Now the Republicans have got a crap cannon.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And it ain't never going to stop shooting crap at them. Of course, now they pretend to want normalcy as they intensify their own campaign of demonization. They keep widening the target. It's not Trump, who is the problem? It's also the people around him and his family and the people who voted for him and people who didn't vote for him, but supportive and people who watch him on TV and people who don't foam at the mouth when he is mentioned and the people who aren't actively resisting him. It's a combination trade and race war, the left now punishes half the population by targeting, smearing, doxing any businesses that might employ anyone who would support Trump. One wonders how far this could go?

utterances.speaker: TOM SHILLUE, HOST
utterances.utterance: What are you eating?

utterances.speaker: STEVE
utterances.utterance: Macadamia nuts. You want some?

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: No, okay. Macadamia nuts are grown in Hawaii. You know what else is in Hawaii? A Trump International Hotel. Hawaii directly benefits from that hotel. So no, I will not be having any of your macadamia nuts. Is that a Flyer shirt?

utterances.speaker: STEVE
utterances.utterance: Yes, favorite team?

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Wow. Just wow.

utterances.speaker: STEVE
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Flyers in Philadelphia. It's in Pennsylvania, a state Trump one in 2016. Nice endorsement of white supremacy.

utterances.speaker: STEVE
utterances.utterance: Okay, well, what's that huh?

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: This?

utterances.speaker: STEVE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: You mean my Captain America action figure?

utterances.speaker: STEVE
utterances.utterance: Oh, you mean Marvel's Captain America action figure, the same Marvel whose CEO, Isaac Perlmutter gave money to Donald Trump this year.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: What's that? A bandana? Nice bandana man, just like the one worn by Bret Michaels in "Celebrity Apprentice" hosted by Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: STEVE
utterances.utterance: Okay, well, what about your shoes, huh? Aren't those the same shoes that were on 49th Street between Fifth and Sixth Avenue where "Saturday Night Live" is filmed? The same "SNL" that gave Donald Trump a platform by letting him host the show twice.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: What about your five-year-old's drawings? Look at them. They obviously used Crayola Crayons. Crayola Crayons owned by Hallmark which owns Hallmark Channel which aired a film called "Broadcasting Christmas Story" known Trump supporter, Dean Cain.

utterances.speaker: STEVE
utterances.utterance: How dare you?

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Is that a kilt? You know Trump's mother is Scottish.

utterances.speaker: STEVE
utterances.utterance: Fine.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Steve, are we not kilt Thursday?

utterances.speaker: STEVE
utterances.utterance: Yes. Thanks Trump.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: Period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Let's welcome tonight's guest. He is so sharp, children are not allowed to run with him. Author and political commentator and host of "The Mark Steyn Show." Mark Steyn.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Even his epitaph will make you laugh comedian, Joe Machi.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She is funny and smart and a little bit tart, host of "Sincerely, Kat" on Fox Nation, Kat Timpf.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And if you follow in his footsteps, you may need a ladder to get out, my massive sidekick, host of "Nuff Said" on Fox Nation, Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We covered a lot here Mark. Feel free to comment on anything. Scaramucci, Greenland, the new trade war against Americans by Americans -- anything?

utterances.speaker: MARK STEYN, AUTHOR AND COLUMNIST
utterances.utterance: I've got to go back to that pre-credits thing, right? I've never seen Rachel Maddow telling a joke before.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: She's got that whole Hillary bobble head. You know when Hillary tells a joke. Rachel Maddow has got the whole Hillary -- and even you know on this -- because what was she saying? She says, "Oh, Trump wants to buy Greenland so he can be the king." You need to try this. This is like all the professional comics there.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: That's why they're so exhausted by Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: And they haven't got the discipline to be boring. When they say make America boring again, as you say, for decades, they've insisted their guys are fascinating, like Clinton, Obama, even Al Gore, they put them on the cover of "Vanity Fair," "Vogue," "Rolling Stone." They pretend they're celebrities.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Even Beto, they put on the cover of "Vanity Fair." Beto who thinks Instagramming himself having ear hair removed.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: It is interesting. And that's the point about politics, I think is they did boring things that the media represented to us as glamorous. So like, Beto O'Rourke's ear hair is glamourous in a way that Bob Dole's hair isn't.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Even though I would bet he has actually got a lot more of it. And so I think they've done -- it takes guts and courage to have the conviction of your own boringness. And they don't have the integrity to be as completely boring as they should be.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: I'm going to try it for the rest of the show.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: It's going quite well so far.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, you've got a head start.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, Joe, what are you excited about? Greenland? Are you excited about anything?

utterances.speaker: JOE MACHI, COMEDIAN
utterances.utterance: I'll tell you what, it's been a roller coaster for Greenland. Because if you read what Trump actually said, it was in the meeting, and someone said, "Denmark is having a lot of trouble with how much they have to spend on Greenland," and someone said, "You should buy it." And he said, "Is that even possible? What do you think?" He at no point said he was going to buy Greenland. But people in Greenland were offended at the idea that America wanted to buy them. You should be so lucky.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kat, thoughts?

utterances.speaker: KATHERINE TIMPF, FOX NATION HOST
utterances.utterance: I just don't understand why there's such a consensus among Democrats that apparently what they need to beat Donald Trump is a boring candidate. If that were the case, Hillary Clinton would have won in 2016.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I mean, she's boring, and it's actually impressive that she manages to be so boring, because usually people who have been the subject of involved criminal investigations are at least a little bit exciting.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: She's like, the most boring criminal ever.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: You know, like I have eaten rice cakes with more pizzazz. So I just think that maybe they should think about that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: You know, but they don't.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, they don't. What about you, Tyrus? Last word. GEORGE "TYRUS" MURDOCH, CONTRIBUTOR: I'm just -- I'm so -- oh, man, I haven't laughed this hard since I was a little school girl, man.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: In my lifetime growing up, I've witnessed and read a lot of history about racism and stuff, but this white racist stuff is awesome. We're going to buy white people. This is amazing. We're going to show up and go, "Get your little white end in the truck. Let's go. You've been bought."

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Like this -- I mean, wow. We've come -- we've got to back up. This is amazing. We're about to buy some white people. Awesome. Let's do it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You always put a unique spin on this.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Yes, I was just -- this is awesome. All white men, nope, and buying -- that's all awesome. Greenland.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Greenland.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: It's smart.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, I look forward to our 51st state.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I always thought those people were green.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, stop there. All right, lots more to come. Which candidate had the best week? How about none of them?

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: And now, “The Greg Gutfeld Show” presents, the 2020 CAN'T-idates.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: A teeth cleaning didn't help. A haircut didn't help. "Vanity Fair" really didn't help. So Beto relaunched his campaign a third time this week by changing something flatter than his poll numbers -- a tire.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He's really weird. Not only does he want to be just like you, he wants to be just like Manny, Moe and Jack.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All the candidates want to just be like you. Watch Mayor Pete go down a slide. Wee. Slides are fun. No, it's no fun being leader of the free world, buddy. Now watch Kamala call bingo at the senior center. What could be more endearing than a visit with a nice sweet senior.

utterances.speaker: SEN. KAMALA HARRIS, D-CALIF., PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: We're going to pay for it because right now, let me tell you something, we're all paying for healthcare for everyone and it's in an emergency room.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Leave our healthcare system alone.

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: We don't want you to mess with it.

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.utterance: I want to make sure your healthcare is really good. So I promise you that. Okay? I won't mess with the healthcare that you have.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That elderly lady had more energy than Joe.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And she's younger. They should run her. The 2020 race also lost this guy.

utterances.speaker: GOV. JOHN HICKENLOOPER, D-COLO.
utterances.utterance: Today, I'm ending my campaign for President. But I will never stop believing that America can only move forward when we work together.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think William Devane sat on that very same porch and tried to sell me gold.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So Hickenlooper is gone, but this guy still lurks.

utterances.speaker: MAYOR BILL DE BLASIO, D-NYC, PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: The tall candidate almost always win.

utterances.speaker: TREVOR NOAH, TALK SHOW HOST
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: And I'm taller than Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, he's right. Here he is playing the piano.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Poor man. Oh, so Joe, what are your thoughts of the candidates? How do you feel about Kamala or Beto?

utterances.speaker: MACHI
utterances.utterance: Oh, I'll tell you what. When you're live streaming yourself changing a tire, I have to wonder, how boring do you think the internet is?

utterances.speaker: MACHI
utterances.utterance: I'm not going to watch that. I'll be on Steven Seagal's Wikipedia page. Thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: MACHI
utterances.utterance: And he's relaunching his campaign, again. That's like relaunching the Titanic after it hit the iceberg. I can tell you how this one ends, Leonardo DiCaprio dies. I just saved you all a good cry.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes. Funny, I didn't cry when that happened.

utterances.speaker: MACHI
utterances.utterance: I didn't either, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kat, thoughts on the Can't-idates?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, the whole Bill de Blasio saying he's going to win because he is tall thing was quite interesting, because you know, things are going well when your best asset is something that all the other candidates could also have if they just invested in a pair of stilts. Right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: But it's like -- and he might be right about the whole, the taller person usually wins. But I bet all those people had something that he does not have, which is that literally everyone did not hate them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: They were probably famous for something other than running a very expensive city that still somehow smells like trash.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: And I'm just sick in general of the candidates. You know, trying to show how much they're like me to get me to vote for them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I don't want this country run by me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, neither do I.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I don't even know where my socks are.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Tyrus? Do you know where your socks are?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Yes, they're all my damn feet.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I'm going to have to hit them with some tough love.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Okay, first of all, y'all remember "Christmas Story." Remember that? Remember how dad changed the tire?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Unless you change a tire like that, you don't video it? Eight seconds.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Not 45 minutes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I shouldn't hear the sound of tools. Second, if you're going down the slide at a park as a grown ass man by yourself. You're a creep. You're not cool.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Got a point.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: So -- and obviously, for those who are watching the show, I've been warning about old white people for a long time. They are tricksters. You cannot trust them. She goes up, she asked her a question -- what does she do? Stabs her in the back.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: You cannot trust. You've got to wait until seven o'clock until those things are asleep.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: It's hard. Just keeping it real, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You are definitely -- Mark, thoughts?

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: She did walk into that nonagenarian trap, right? I was guest hosting for Tucker all this week. So, I've had all these fine producers, e-mailing me all this political stuff every day. And this gets back to what you were saying that the Democrats want to be boring. And politics is boring. And so when you wake up in the morning and the first thing they've sent you is the mayor of South Bend, Indiana going down a slide, and as you say, it's creepy because everyone else on the slide is 40 years younger than him.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Then the next thing I get is Andrew Yang during a jazzercise class.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: How many of you have ever seen Andrew Yang during a jazzercise class?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I saw it today.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: He moves at the jazzercise class like Rachel Maddow telling a joke. And that's a problem. But politics is presented -- there's nothing interesting about seeing a grown man eat a corn dog. There's nothing interesting about seeing --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I beg to differ. I live for it.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: You might be eating corn dog while doing your jazzercise class.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There you go.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: I would see --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I would watch that in a heartbeat. It's interesting. You know, Joe Biden is essentially like the mother and psycho. They're keeping her in the attic until the very end. And it's played by Anthony Perkins. Up next. Cuomo says "No mo about Fredo."

utterances.speaker: AISHAH HASNIE, CORRESPONDENT
utterances.utterance: Live from "America's News Headquarters," I'm Aishah Hasnie. An 11th weekend now protesting in Hong Kong. Riot police deployed Saturday evening at several locations across the city. Protesters gathering outside one police station shining laser pointers at police and also pelting them with eggs. Riot police moved in on many of the protesters that had already melted into a crowd in the densely populated district. More bloodshed at Afghanistan, a suicide bomb ripping through a wedding hall in Kabul. Dozens of people were killed or wounded. A spokesman for the Interior Ministry there says more than a thousand people have been invited to that wedding. The explosion coming just days after the end of the Eid al-Adha, a holiday period. It broke more than a week of calm in the capital. No word yet on who is behind the attack. I'm Aishah Hasnie, now back to “The Greg Gutlfeld Show.”

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You got hot and bothered over some guy than "The Godfather." CNN's Chris Cuomo was caught on camera giving it back hard to some guy who called him Fredo. So what do you say? Let's get after it.

utterances.speaker: CHRIS CUOMO, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.utterance: Don't [bleep] insult me like that.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: What's the problem? I didn't insult you.

utterances.speaker: CUOMO
utterances.utterance: What the [bleep] you called me Fredo. It's like I call you punk [bleep], you like that? You want that to be your nickname?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I didn't call you that, I asked you --

utterances.speaker: CUOMO
utterances.utterance: You called me Fredo. You know my name is not [bleep] Fredo.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I thought your name was.

utterances.speaker: CUOMO
utterances.utterance: You did not think my name was [bleep] Fredo. Don't be a liar. I'll [bleep] ruin your [bleep]. I'll [bleep] throw you down these stairs like [bleep] punk.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Please do.

utterances.speaker: CUOMO
utterances.utterance: Why? So you can [bleep] sue? So you can [bleep] sue? So you can [bleep] sue?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Why don't you do it then?

utterances.speaker: CUOMO
utterances.utterance: Take a swing, if you want to call me Fredo, take a [bleep] swing.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I'm not going to swing at you.

utterances.speaker: CUOMO
utterances.utterance: Take a [bleep] swing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Is it wrong to be aroused? So the video goes everywhere, Trump not only tweets about it, his campaign starts selling a shirt with Cuomo's picture on it --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That says, "Fredo Unhinged." But is Fredo a slur. Italian- Americans say no according to "The New York Post" and come on, it's nowhere near the equivalent of the N-word as Cuomo maintains. Fredo was the weaker, less intelligent brother in a movie. So Fredo is an insult to weaker, less intelligent brothers. You know, kind of the way calling someone Darth Vader is an insult to absent fathers who sound a lot like James Earl Jones wearing a scuba regulator.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Or calling someone Hannibal is an insult a well-read serial killing cannibals. Or calling someone Scarface as an insult to a highly successful and motivated coke dealers. Or calling someone Frodo is an insult a spry little fellows from Middle Earth. And you ask what if he is the weaker brother of Frodo? Fredo Frodo.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Tyrus, I'm going to ask you. He likens the term to the N-word. I would assume you have to --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I am going to give him the nay-no on that one. But again, this has never been a better time to be black. I mean, why people are inventing racist names for each other. For years, we had like white bread, and like honky. Like that didn't really work. They go like, "That's funny. What is that?" But Fredo apparently, we have to bleep it out, are we bleeping Fredo out?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, we are not bleeping Fredo.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: We're not bleeping Fredo, not yet? But real quick.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Real quick. I don't have a problem with what he did. Someone came at him, he is with his family. You've got to defend yourself.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: But I have a problem with his language. I'm going to teach him and everyone else if you're in a situation where someone comes at you because they disagree with your political beliefs, you have to be able to hit them back to where they get confused and leave you alone because if you hit him, you get sued, like the guy wanting him thrown down the stairs, right? So Joe, would you volunteer for me for a sec.

utterances.speaker: MACHI
utterances.utterance: Sure.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: MACHI
utterances.utterance: Let's do this.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Say something aggressive to me?

utterances.speaker: MACHI
utterances.utterance: You sir, are --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I said say something aggressive.

utterances.speaker: MACHI
utterances.utterance: You are a charlatan?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: You've got anything else?

utterances.speaker: MACHI
utterances.utterance: You are a large charlatan.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Now instead of hitting him, or say, "I'm going to throw you down the stairs," you get right in the face. Good day, sir. He doesn't know what to do.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Good day, sir. Hit them with a compliment aggressively, the press can't replay that. What happened? "Tyrus, got in my face and he said 'Good day, sir.'" Aggressive compliments, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Aggressive compliment. You know, Kat, you've had some confrontations in your life. How do you think Chris handled this?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, I mean, I'm going to refrain from making fun of him. Not because I particularly like him, but because I do particularly like me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: And I need the karma.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Like, what if somebody takes the video of me when the deli runs out of egg salad?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's right.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Like I don't throw anyone down the stairs, but I wouldn't necessarily put it on my resume. Especially if it's egg salad Friday. Am I right?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: She loves egg salad.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Am I right? Egg Salad Friday? Look, I don't know. I thought confrontations. And what I've done is cry.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That works.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I've seen it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Is that better?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think it's better.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Is it better?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think it's great to cry because then you get the sympathy vote.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: You get the sympathy vote and you release endorphins.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's true. What do you do? How do you think this -- how did Chris handle this, Mark?

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Well, I thought he -- I think he's finally found something he is good at. I love -- I love it when he goes, what the [bleep] and [bleep] are you doing [bleep]? The [bleep] button can retire to the Bahamas on that clip over time, and he is not Fredo. He is actually -- because as you explained, Fredo is the weaker brother of Bilbo.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
